title: NY Judge found that Trump committed fraud by inflating value of assets
description: Donald Trump and his sons Eric and Don Jr defrauded banks, insurers while building real estate empire, by inflating the value of the real estate and financial assets of the Trump Organization for years, a New York judge ruled on Tuesday.

title: Hollywood actors vote to authorize new walkout against video game makers
description: 98% of SAG-AFTRA members voted to go on strike against video game companies if negotiations are not successful.

title: Shakira faces new probe for tax fraud in Spain
description: Court documents, dating from May, say she used a "corporate framework" involving companies, some of which were based in tax havens, to avoid paying the tax.

title: US President Biden makes history by joining picket line
description: The autoworkers strike that began on September 15 has increasingly become a political football for Biden and Trump as they head for a probable rematch next year.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Dozens dead in gas-station explosion, as thousands of residents flee to Armenia
description: The cause of the blast on Monday remains unclear, but Nagorno-Karabakh presidential aide David Babayan said initial information suggested that it resulted from negligence.

title: Canada's House speaker resigns over inviting man who fought for Nazis to parliament
description: The speaker of Canada's parliament faced growing calls to resign September 26,  after he singled out a Ukrainian veteran alleged to have fought for the Nazis during World War II for a standing ovation during a visit by Ukraine's leader.

title: Lampedusa, at the gates of Fortress Europe
description: On the borders of Europe and Africa, at the crossroads of migrants' hopes and European tensions, the Italian island's history has been punctuated by the tragedy of shipwrecks. It has been in the spotlight since the arrival of thousands of asylum seekers in mid-September.

title: French military in disarray as troops withdrawn from Africa
description: Over and above the security issues put forward as a reason for keeping soldiers there, Africa is a popular location for military staff.

title: UEFA reinstates Russian youth teams
description: European football's governing body maintained its ban on senior teams.

title: JPMorgan to pay $75 million on claims it enabled Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operations
description: The bank is paying the settlement to the US Virgin Islands, where the late American financier had an estate. The Virgin Islands said JPMorgan enabled Epstein's recruiters to pay victims.

title: One trillion dollars in seven years: an endless supply of  funding for the expansion of fossil fuels
description: 'Fossil Finance' (2/2). Oil and gas companies have had no trouble financing their expansion activities in recent years thanks to bonds issued with the assistance of most of the world’s major banks.

title: How European banks help oil and gas giants acquire billions
description: 'Fossil Finance' (1/2). Banks have helped the fossil fuel industry find over €1 trillion in financing since 2016. French banks are among the most active in this bond market.

title: Rugby World Cup: Dupont's injury, 'an ordinary fracture suffered by an extraordinary patient'
description: Injured during the match against Namibia, the French captain has undergone surgery on his cheekbone and is hoping to play again before the end of the World Cup, ideally as early as the quarter-finals scheduled for mid-October.

title: Macron and Meloni meet in Rome amid tensions over migration
description: The French leader was in Italy to attend former president Giorgio Napolitano's state funeral. A sharp rise in migrant landings to the Italian island of Lampedusa has reignited a bitter debate across the EU.

title: More carrots than sticks: Macron outlines new environmental policy
description: On September 25, the French president finally reached a decision with his environmental planning council. He insisted on more financial aid in the transport and housing sectors and called for lifestyle changes instead of outright bans.

title: French climate plan: A precarious balance
description: Torn between the 'cure' advocated by degrowth proponents and the far-right's climate denial, Macron wants to incentivize rather than constrain. But he runs the risk of slowing the transition and leaving France stuck in the middle of the road.

title: The journey to a €49/month rail pass for France begins
description: This pass, inspired by the German example, would allow unlimited use of regional, inter-regional and local trains and public transport services throughout France. The regions are reluctant to participate.

title: Normalization of Israeli-Arab country relations: The Palestinian Authority changes its strategy
description: Rather than directly opposing the ongoing reconciliation between Riyadh and the Jewish state, over which it has little control, the regime in Ramallah is trying to make the most of it.

title: Antarctic sea ice at lowest winter maximum on record, data shows
description: For many decades, the Antarctic sea ice pack had remained stable, even expanding slightly. Scientists still debate the cause of the shift but many blame global warming.

title: Air France-KLM plans to order 50 Airbus A350 jets
description: The order represents more than $16 billion at list prices. The aircraft will be delivered between 2026 and 2030.

title: The great denial: France's unspoken reliance on immigrant labor
description: They are our security guards, our nursing assistants, our hospital doctors, and much more. Far from the far-right's fantasy of demographic submersion, immigrants are helping to alleviate the labor shortage affecting the French economy.

title: As Anti-France sentiment rises, Burkina Faso suspends French news outlet 'Jeune Afrique'
description: The Burkinabe government, led by the junta following the 2022 coup, has repeatedly attacked both foreign and domestic media in recent months.

title: Nationalist, libertarian far-right alliance takes root in Poland
description: The Konfederacja alliance of right-wing and far-right political parties, which won its first seat in the Polish lower house in 2019, could quadruple its number of MPs in the October 15 legislative elections.

title: Over 160 flights canceled this week at London's Gatwick airport
description: The British capital's second-largest airport is facing an exceptional shortage of air traffic controllers, partly due to a recent spike in Covid-19 cases.

title: Canadian media increasingly concerned about Meta's blockade
description: No news content has been published on the country's Facebook pages since August 1st, jeopardizing the economic equilibrium of many media outlets – particularly pure players.

title: Macron's climate agenda: What’s in store for French transportation
description: Emmanuel Macron has outlined some elements of his roadmap for decarbonizing transportation, including a long-term leasing program for electric cars aimed at low-income households and promoting the use of metropolitan commuter trains (RER).

title: Russia plans to increase its military budget by 70% in 2024
description: The classified government spendings – which also cover the exceptional compensations paid out to the families of fallen soldiers – would also double. For the first time, defense has overtaken social policy.
